conclusion: Determine the maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to block B without causing A and B to move.
Consider the forces acting on each block and the conditions for static and kinetic friction.
Block A has a mass of 1 kg and block B has a mass of 2 kg.
Coefficient of kinetic friction between B and the ground is 0.1.
Calculate the maximum static friction force between A and B using the formula: maximum static friction force = 1 N.
Since the maximum static friction force is 1 N, the maximum force F that can be applied to block B without causing A and B to move is 1 N.
Check the condition for kinetic friction.
Calculate the maximum kinetic friction force between B and the ground using the formula: maximum kinetic friction force = 0.1 * (1 + 2) = 0.3 N.
Since the maximum kinetic friction force is 0.3 N, the maximum force F that can be applied to block B without causing A and B to move is 0.3 N.
The maximum horizontal force F that can be applied to block B without causing A and B to move is 1 N.
